description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: Data should relate to all sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
On average it takes 5 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: Please complete this survey even if you are a sole trader and it does not seem relevant to your business. All returns are important, as it allows decision-makers to understand how businesses of all sizes are performing in the current climate.
Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This survey has the following sections:
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information on any changes to your business's turnover in the last month and expectations for the next month.
This section asks for information about:

list: prices of goods and services bought or sold over the last month and expectations for the next month
demand for goods and services over the last month

contents.description: This section asks for information about the business's stock levels and stockpiling.
This section asks for information about:

list: the main concern to your business

contents.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: percentage, for example, of those working from home, using a hybrid model or made redundant over the last month

contents.description: This section asks for information about the changes to the numbers of workers from within and outside the EU.
We are asking these questions to help understand how workforce characteristics may have changed across different business sectors.
This section asks for information about:

list: current actions taken by your business to protect the environment
current actions taken by your business to reduce carbon emissions
barriers preventing business from taking action
climate change impacts considered in your business's investment plans

contents.description: We are asking this to understand how the UK Government's target of net zero carbon emissions may be affecting business's actions in relation to climate change.
This section asks for information about:

The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)
This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.

title.text: Which of the following statements best describes {ru_name}'s trading status?

description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

contents.description: This section asks for information on any changes to your business's turnover in the last month and expectations for the next month.

title.text: How did {ru_name}’s turnover in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

question.title: What are your business’s expectations for turnover in December 2023?
description: When considering expectations, compare to your business's current turnover.

options.label: Expect turnover to stay the same
options.value: Expect turnover to stay the same

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: prices of goods and services bought or sold over the last month and expectations for the next month
demand for goods and services over the last month

title.text: How did the prices of goods or services bought by {ru_name} in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

question.title: How did the prices of goods or services sold by your business in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

blocks.page_title: Prices of goods or services sold

question.title: What are your business's expectations for the prices of goods or services sold in December 2023?
description: When considering expectations, compare to your business's current prices of goods or services.

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

blocks.page_title: Expectations for prices of goods or services sold

question.title: Which of the following factors, if any, are causing your business to consider raising prices in December 2023?

options.label: Finance costs
options.description: For example, commissions, fees and interest rates

options.label: Business is not considering raising prices
options.value: Business is not considering raising prices

blocks.page_title: Factors causing business to consider raising prices

question.title: How did your business’s domestic demand for goods and services in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Include:

list: the volume of orders in your business’s total order book

contents.description: Exclude:

blocks.page_title: Domestic demand for goods and services

question.title: How did your business’s international demand for goods and services in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Include:

list: the volume of orders in your business’s export order book

contents.description: Exclude:

blocks.page_title: International demand for goods and services

question.title: Has your business been affected by recent increases in energy prices?

contents.description: Include:

options.label: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected
options.value: Yes, both production and suppliers have been affected

options.label: No, the business has not been affected
options.value: No, the business has not been affected

blocks.page_title: Effect of increases in energy prices

question.title: In which of the following ways, if any, has your business been affected by price rises?

contents.description: Include any price rises that your business has experienced

options.label: Had to absorb costs
options.description: For example, business took no action or used cash reserves

options.label: Had to access more financial support
options.value: Had to access more financial support
options.description: For example, borrowing loans, issuing shares and bonds, or taking on debt

options.label: Had to pass on price increases to customers
options.value: Had to pass on price increases to customers

options.label: Had to reduce staff work hours
options.value: Had to reduce staff work hours

options.label: Unable to maintain workspaces
options.description: For example, due to rising energy costs

options.label: Business has not been affected by price rises
options.value: Business has not been affected by price rises

Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

contents.description: This section asks for information about the business's stock levels and stockpiling.

title.text: How did {ru_name}'s stock levels of raw materials in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Include:
Exclude:
This refers to the basic input goods that your business requires to manufacture its products.

question.title: How did your business's stock levels of finished goods in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?

contents.description: Exclude:
This refers to goods that have completed the manufacturing process and are ready for sale.

question.title: Is your business stockpiling any goods or materials?
Where is your business sourcing these stockpiled goods or materials from?
Which of the following goods or materials is your business stockpiling?

options.label: Materials
options.description: For example, building and construction materials, metals, paper or wood

options.label: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
options.description: For example, aprons, face masks and gloves

options.label: Other consumer goods
options.description: For example, beauty products, cleaning products, clothes, pet supplies or sports equipment

blocks.page_title: Type of goods or materials stockpiled

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: the main concern to your business

question.title: Which of the following, if any, will be the main concern for your business in December 2023?

options.label: Falling demand of goods and services
options.value: Falling demand of goods and services

options.label: Inflation of goods and services prices
options.value: Inflation of goods and services prices

question.title: In the last 12 months, has your business sold goods or services to customers in other UK nations?

contents.description: Exclude trade within the same UK nation

definitions.title: What we mean by 'other UK nations'

contents.description: This refers to selling to suppliers in a UK nation outside of the nation where the majority of your business resides. The four nations that make up the UK are England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

blocks.page_title: Selling to customers in other UK nations

question.title: In the last 12 months, which of the following challenges, if any, has your business experienced when selling goods or services to customers in other UK nations?

contents.description: Exclude trade within the same UK nation

definitions.title: What we mean by 'other UK nations'

contents.description: This refers to selling to suppliers in a UK nation outside of the nation where the majority of your business resides. The four nations that make up the UK are England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

options.label: Challenges related to the Northern Ireland Protocol
options.value: Challenges related to the Northern Ireland Protocol

options.label: Differences in rules or regulations
options.description: Excluding challenges related to the Northern Ireland Protocol

options.label: Business did not experience any challenges
options.value: Business did not experience any challenges

blocks.page_title: Challenges selling to customers in other UK nations

contents.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: percentage, for example, of those working from home, using a hybrid model or made redundant over the last month

title.text: In October 2023, approximately what percentage of {ru_name}'s workforce were:

description:
If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

Your answers need to add up to 100%. If your workforce did not fall into any of the top five categories, enter '0', then use the 'Other' box at the bottom to bring the total to 100%. Every box must have an answer between '0' and '100'.

Informed estimates are acceptable.

contents.description: Include both full-time and part-time employees

answers.label: Working from a designated workspace
answers.description: For example, office buildings, retail shops or construction sites

answers.label: Using a hybrid model of working
answers.description: For example, using a mixture of working from home and a designated workspace

guidance.show_guidance: What we mean by a 'designated workspace'
guidance.hide_guidance: What we mean by a 'designated workspace'

contents.description: This refers to a workplace, excluding the home.
Examples include:

list: community or shared work-spaces such as Hubs
work vehicles such as HGVs, vans and company cars

question.title: How did the number of employees at your business in October 2023 compare with the previous calendar month?
description:
Informed estimates are acceptable.

If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

options.label: Number of employees stayed the same
options.value: Number of employees stayed the same

question.title: What are your business’s expectations for the number of employees in December 2023?
description:
Informed estimates are acceptable.

If you are a sole trader and do not have a workforce, please base your answers on your own working arrangement.

When considering expectations, compare to your business's current number of employees.

contents.description: Exclude seasonal changes

options.label: Number of employees will stay the same
options.value: Number of employees will stay the same

blocks.page_title: Expectations for business's number of employees

question.title: Did your business experience any difficulties recruiting employees in October 2023?

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

list: current actions taken by your business to protect the environment
current actions taken by your business to reduce carbon emissions
barriers preventing business from taking action
climate change impacts considered in your business's investment plans

contents.description: We are asking this to understand how the UK Government's target of net zero carbon emissions may be affecting business's actions in relation to climate change.

title.text: Is {ru_name} concerned about the impact climate change may have on the business?

blocks.page_title: Addressing the impacts of climate change

question.title: Which of the following actions, if any, has your business taken to protect the environment?

options.label: Has a nature or biodiversity strategy
options.value: Has a nature or biodiversity strategy

options.label: Has a nature or biodiversity target
options.value: Has a nature or biodiversity target

options.label: Has a nature or biodiversity target which includes supply chain
options.value: Has a nature or biodiversity target which includes supply chain

options.label: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target
options.value: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target

options.label: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target which includes supply chain
options.value: Has a net zero or greenhouse gas emissions target which includes supply chain

options.label: Monitors climate-related risks
options.description: For example, increased frequency or severity of extreme weather conditions, floods, droughts, fires and sea level rises

options.label: Monitors nature or biodiversity-related risks
options.description: For example, disruption to supply chains, increasing regulatory compliance costs, fluctuating prices, environmental degradation and small crop yields

blocks.page_title: Actions taken to protect the environment

question.title: Which of the following actions, if any, have you taken to reduce your business's carbon emissions?

options.label: Adjusting heating and cooling systems
options.description: For example, temperature, timings and reducing number of rooms being heated or cooled

options.label: Installing your own renewable electricity or heating
options.value: Installing your own renewable electricity or heating

options.label: Introducing a cycle to work scheme
options.value: Introducing a cycle to work scheme

options.label: No actions have been taken to reduce emissions
options.value: No actions have been taken to reduce emissions

blocks.page_title: Actions taken to reduce carbon emissions

question.title: Which of the following barriers, if any, have prevented your business from taking action to reduce its carbon emissions?

options.label: Lack of access to infrastructure
options.description: For example, Electric Vehicle charging networks

options.label: Lack of relevance to the business
options.value: Lack of relevance to the business

options.label: Lack of skilled labour to implement change
options.value: Lack of skilled labour to implement change

options.label: Business has not been prevented from taking action
options.value: Business has not been prevented from taking action

blocks.page_title: Barriers preventing business from taking action

question.title: To what extent are climate change impacts considered in your business's investment plans?

contents.description: This section asks for information about:

title.text: In October 2023, how did your {ru_name}'s debt repayments compare with turnover?

contents.description: This refers to all loans and bonds, both public and private, that are payable in the future.

options.label: Repayments were more than 100% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were more than 100% of turnover

options.label: Repayments were between 50% and 100% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were between 50% and 100% of turnover

options.label: Repayments were between 20% and 50% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were between 20% and 50% of turnover

options.label: Repayments were up to 20% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were up to 20% of turnover

question.title: How much confidence does your business have that it will meet its current debt obligations?

options.label: Do not have any debt obligations
options.value: Do not have any debt obligations

question.title: What is your business's risk of insolvency?

contents.description: This is where a business cannot pay its debts when they are due or the business owes more than it owns.

question.title: How would you describe your business’s overall performance in October 2023, compared with this calendar month last year?
description: Consider all aspects of your business contributing to overall performance such as pricing, trading and workforce.

question.title: How do you expect your business’s overall performance to change over the next 12 months?
description: Consider all aspects of your business contributing to overall performance such as pricing, trading and workforce.
